snippet: “The Houston Impenetrable,” a shimmering kinetic installation at the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston, is as full of logistical challenges as aesthetic delights.
abstract: Large-scale installation by Jesus Rafael Soto is set to open at the Museum of Fine Arts in Houston following almost a decade of effort and expense; work consists of 24,000 plastic tubes that create a perceptual maze of light and color through which visitors wander; significant logistical questions remain about how to preserve the artwork while allowing viewers to explore it freely.
lead_paragraph: “The Houston Impenetrable,” a shimmering kinetic installation at the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston, is as full of logistical challenges as aesthetic delights.

headline.seo: A Jesús Rafael Soto Installation Opens in Houston
headline.main: A Romp in Gossamer, 8 Tons’ Worth
headline.print_headline: A Romp in Gossamer, 8 Tons’ Worth
